meanings.definition: A smaller division or offshoot of a larger branch.
meanings.sent1: The tree had many subbranches growing from its main branch.
meanings.sent2: The subbranches of the company expanded into different markets.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the subbranches as a secret hideout for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The subbranches of knowledge intertwine to form a vast tree of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The subbranches of the river spread out like fingers into the valley.

meanings.sent1: She decided to subbranches the project to focus on specific areas.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to subbranches its operations to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The chef will subbranches the recipe to create new flavors.
meanings.sent4: His ideas subbranches into innovative solutions for everyday problems.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity subbranches into various forms of expression.
